I am not sure why that is not happenning. You can test any class that
exist=
s and is accessible in the class path with junit. No
Restrictions. !!!! Whe=
ther it is in a directory or in a jar file.

Are you sure that the jar file=
 containing the classes you are testing
and the junit jar files included in=
 the class path!?

Also if you tell us what is the error you are getting, i=
t would be easier.

Sarath.
